Speaking to The Sun, Jane Lynch has claimed that when playing acid-tongued cheerleading coach Sue, she draws inspiration from The actress told the tabloid: I think Sue Sylvester has British in her. I think the US look at the British as a race that tells it how it is, and if ever there was a guy who tells it like it is, then it's Simon Cowell . "He's a great inspiration for the character of Sue- there is a lot that I can take from him and put into her. You could definitely look at Sue and say there's a

. There's no surprise in the Simon Cowell that Rushfield presents, but he does bring him to life-- by turns brilliant and exasperating, self-serving and disarmingly honest. Rushfield sums him up well: If ever a person could be prepared for fame and all that came with it, it was Simon Cowell .... For 20 years, Simon Cowell had been involved in every aspect of the shadowy business of creating stars.... He had seen how the magical alchemy could transform people into stars, and he had seen how it could go wrong. The book is not Fox-authorized, which may explain why the show's other well-known personalities play only supporting roles. Paula Abdul is a wacky sparring partner, and Ryan Seacrest is Robin to Simon Cowell 's Batman.

Chrysler emerge from bankruptcy in June 2009 and form a partnership with Fiat SpA. Advertisement That will be an accomplishment for an automaker many thought would not survive, even with bailouts. The fact that Chrysler will have positive operating profit and a positive cash flow makes them more of a comeback kid than Ford( Motor Co.) is, said Warren Browne, vice president of business development for AutomotiveCompass LLC in Northville.
